intro: Biscutella laevigata subsp. prinzerae, commonly known as the Prinzerae biscuitroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
